org.araneaframework.http.core
Class StandardServletInputData

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.http.core.StandardServletInputData
All Implemented Interfaces:
Extendable, HttpInputData, InputData, Narrowable
public class StandardServletInputData
extends Object
implements HttpInputData

A ServletInputdata implementation which uses a StandardPath for determining the scope.

Author:
"Toomas RÃ¶mer"

getContainerURL

public String getContainerURL()
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Returns an URL pointing to the Aranea container (in most cases the dispatcher servlet) that also contains servlet information. Note that this method is the main (central) method used to retrieve an URL in Aranea. Therefore the implementation plays an important role how client-side references work.

Specified by:
getContainerURL in interface HttpInputData
Returns:
The URL pointing to the dispatcher servlet of Aranea. The implementation may decide, if the URL will contain the protocol and server information or not.

getContainerPath

public String getContainerPath()
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Returns the part of this request's URL that calls the servlet. This path starts with a "/" character and includes either the servlet name or a path to the servlet, but does not include any extra path information or a query string. In URL, the container path (if provided in the request) follows the context path.

Specified by:
getContainerPath in interface HttpInputData
Returns:
A String containing the name or path of the servlet being called, or an empty String.
See Also:
HttpServletRequest.getServletPath()

getContextURL

public String getContextURL()
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Returns an URL pointing to the Aranea container context (in most cases the web application root).

Specified by:
getContextURL in interface HttpInputData
Returns:
A String containing the name or path of the servlet being called, or an empty String.

getRequestURL

public String getRequestURL()
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Returns the target URL of the current request. The returned URL contains a protocol, server name, port number, and server path, but it does not include query string parameters.

Specified by:
getRequestURL in interface HttpInputData
Returns:
The target URL of the current request.

public Locale getLocale()
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Returns the preferred Locale that the client will accept content in, based on the Accept-Language header. If the client request doesn't provide an Accept-Language header, this method returns the default locale for the server.

getSimplePath

public String getSimplePath()
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Returns the path on the server starting from the dispatcher servlet that has been submitted as the part of the request target URL. Unlike HttpInputData.getPath(), removes all forward-slashes from the beginning of the path.

Specified by:
getSimplePath in interface HttpInputData
Returns:
The path without forward-slashes in the beginning.

popPathPrefix

public String popPathPrefix()
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Restores the previously consumed path prefix.

Specified by:
popPathPrefix in interface HttpInputData
Returns:
The restored path element.

pushPathPrefix

public void pushPathPrefix(String pathPrefix)
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Consumes the path prefix (may be nested) allowing children to be mapped to a relative path. The children won't now that a path element was consumed, and to them, the path is like they expect.

This is useful for components that listen for requests that match a certain path under the root context. For example, a component that received request for "/a/b" may use pushPathPrefix("a") so that components listening for "/b" could processed as well.

Specified by:
pushPathPrefix in interface HttpInputData
Parameters:
pathPrefix - The path prefix to consume. Must not contain a forward-slash!

setCharacterEncoding

public void setCharacterEncoding(String encoding)
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Sets the character encoding that is used to decode request parameters. Note that this must be called before any parameters are read according to the Servlet specification.

Specified by:
setCharacterEncoding in interface HttpInputData
Parameters:
encoding - The character encoding that will be used to decode request parameters.

startsWith

protected static boolean startsWith(String src,
                                    String pathItem)
Checks whether the path (src) starts with the given pathItem. Similar to String.startsWith(String), but does not care whether the path starts with a forward-slash ("/").

Parameters:
src - The path.
pathItem - The path item that the path must begin with. Must not contain a forward-slash!
Returns:
Whether the path starts with the given pathItem
Since:
2.0

trim

Removes forward-slashes from the beginning of the input string.

Parameters:
path - The string from which forward-slashes should be removed from the beginning.
Returns:
The input string without forward-slashes in the beginning.
Since:
2.0

setUseFullURL

public void setUseFullURL(boolean useFullURL)
Description copied from interface: HttpInputData
Provides a way to specify whether the URL returned by HttpInputData.getContainerURL() starts with the protocol server and server information or just starts with the slash to represent the URL starting with context path.

Specified by:
setUseFullURL in interface HttpInputData
Parameters:
useFullURL - A Boolean indicating whether the path should be absolute or relative to the host.
